intro: Bonatea minor, commonly known as the small bonatea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Bonatea minor thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist woodlands or along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for cultivation in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
